abstract: Ottawa Journal; politically charged proposal in Canada's capital Ottawa to build immense monument to global victims of Communism has sparked heated debate; aside from flouting capital's reputation for modesty, swelling chorus of critics say notion of using district's scarce green space for outsized structure with no direct link to Canada's history is unacceptable.
lead_paragraph: A proposal to build an immense memorial in Ottawa to the global victims of Communism has prompted protests from architects, the mayor and the country’s chief justice.

headline.main: An Immodest Proposal Rankles a Capital Known for Modesty
headline.print_headline: An Immodest Proposal Rankles a Capital Known for Modesty

snippet: A proposal to build an immense memorial in Ottawa to the global victims of Communism has prompted protests from architects, the mayor and the country’s chief justice.
